title: Targets files don't have a file association/icon
body:
Looking at props/targets files, the former has a file association with VS, along with an icon, while targets is missing and lonely 😊
 
 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1427284/52875811-430c3280-3123-11e9-8a8c-89c49556b3b7.png)

The description is a TARGETS file, as it’s not a registered file type.
 
It’s a small thing, but can VS add something for this?

nodes.body: Sounds reasonable to me. I believe this is controlled by (internal link) [this setup manifest](https://dev.azure.com/devdiv/DevDiv/_git/VS?path=%2Fsrc%2FSetupPackages%2FCoreIde%2FCommunity%2Fres%2FFileAssociations%2Fext.vcxproj.swr&version=GTrelease%2Fvs%2F16.0-preview.4&line=44&lineStyle=plain&lineEnd=47&lineStartColumn=1&lineEndColumn=76).
Marking this as a duplicate even though the other bug is newer because @davkean is doing this.
